author: LANCE LUTRELL Tribune correspondent
title: Pewitt defeats Hughes Springs
text: LaBrandon Webster scored two touchdowns. Posted: Friday, October 23, 2015 8:42 am Pewitt defeats Hughes Springs By LANCE LUTRELL Tribune correspondent dailytribune.net | 0 comments Pewitt hosted Hughes Springs thursday night and walked away with a dominating 41-6 victory. Pewittâ€™s offense pounded the Mustang defense for 347 yards on the ground while the defense shut down the Hughes Springs run game holding them to 153 yards on the night. Hughes Springs went three and out on their first offensive series giving the ball back to Pewitt. The Bulls drove 66 yards in nine plays capped off by a 14-yard scoring run by Tyran Betts. Pewitt missed the extra point. Another quick three-and-out from Hughes Springs led to another Pewitt touchdown when LaBrandon Webster scored on a 3-yard run. Another missed PAT made the score 12-0 Bulls at the end of the first quarter. Pewitt continued to control the game in the second quarter. Betts scored on a 5-yard run and Pewitt made their first extra point of the night for a 19-0 Bulls lead with 9:19 left in the second. After another defensive stop Webster scored his second touchdown of the night. John Terrell connected with Lucas Hungerford for the 2-point conversion giving Pewitt a 27-0 lead at the half. Tyshun Mitchell ran the opening kickoff back to the Mustangs 37 where it took Lamon Hillis one play to score giving Pewitt a 34-0 lead just 25 seconds into the third quarter. Betts finished the scoring for the Bulls with his third rushing score of the night on a 6-yard run. Hillis lead the Bulls ground attack with a 121 yards on 19 carries. Betts added 105 yards on just nine attempts. The Brahmas defense was lead by Alex Jones with 10 tackles. Mitchell an Hillis both had interceptions. With the win the Bulls go to 5-3 on year an 3-0 in district play. The loss puts the Mustangs to 1-2 in district play. Pewitt will next be in action at 7:30 p.m. next Friday when they host Linden-Kildare.
